Description:
The FHIR Patient resource defines demographics, care providers, and other administrative information about a person receiving care at a health organization. The Patient resource can be thought of as the starting point for many different client application workflows; often, a workflow will begin with a patient query and selection, and the server ID will be used to drive additional queries for diagnostic and care-related information.

The Patient resource corresponds to the following Common Clinical Data Set (CCDS) Elements: Patient Name, DOB, Race, Ethnicity, Preferred Language, and Care Team.

The search interaction enables the client to query for patients based on a specified set of demographics information. The Patient Search endpoint allows clients to establish an identifier for a patient without previously receiving unique identification from the server for the patient.

Note: Epic's patient search implementation only returns patients with strong demographics matches. Most query parameters will return no results unless used in concert with more specific demographic information.
Note: Epic's support of the Patient resource only allows retrieving the most up-to-date demographics info. Previous demographic information cannot be queried for.
Note: Epic's patient search implementation offers health systems flexibility to define which demographic property combinations are used when searching for patients.  The allowed search parameter combinations available in the sandbox may differ from those allowed by health systems.

Supported Patient Extensions

In addition to the Standard FHIR Patient resource, Epic supports the following patient-level extensions:

US Core Race
Coded value of the Patient's documented race using the HL7 Version 3 Race Code System. 

    {"url": "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/us-core-race", "valueCodeableConcept": {"text": "Asian", "coding": [{"system": "2.16.840.1.113883.5.104", "code": "2028-9", "display": "Asian"}] }}


US Core Ethnicity
Coded value of the Patient's documented ethnicity using the HL7 Version 3 Ethnicity Code System. 

   {"url": "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/us-core-ethnicity", "valueCodeableConcept": {"text": "Not Hispanic or Latino", "coding": [{"system": "2.16.840.1.113883.5.50", "code": "2186-5", "display": "Not Hispanic or Latino"}] }}


US Core Birth Sex
Coded value of the Patient's documented birth sex using the HL7 Version 3 Administrative Gender Code System, as required by ONC regulation. Note: if no birth sex is documented, a value will not be returned. 

   {"url": "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/us-core-birth-sex", "valueCodeableConcept": { "text": "Male", "coding": [{"system": "http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/AdministrativeGender", "code": "M", "display": "Male"}] }}

</Bundle>
Remarks: FHIR Patient resources can be retrieved via a Read or Search interaction and can be consumed as either XML or JSON. Searches most often utilize the Identity Duplicate Checking infrastructure. A released IDC record will allow this web service to perform searches. A search may return as many as 100 potential matches.

_id.Name: _id
_id.Optional:
If provided, all other input parameters will be ignored.

One of the following input combinations must be provided at minimum:

  • _id (aka FHIR ID)
  • identifier in the form {IDType}|{ID}, which includes SSN
  • Given name, family name, and birthdate
  • Given name, family name, gender, and communication (phone number/email)

birthdate.Name: birthdate
birthdate.Description: The patient's date of birth in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
birthdate.Optional:
One of the following input combinations must be provided at minimum:

  • _id (aka FHIR ID)
  • identifier in the form {IDType}|{ID}, which includes SSN
  • Given name, family name, and birthdate
  • Given name, family name, gender, and communication (phone number/email)

family.Name: family
family.Optional:
One of the following input combinations must be provided at minimum:

  • _id (aka FHIR ID)
  • identifier in the form {IDType}|{ID}, which includes SSN
  • Given name, family name, and birthdate
  • Given name, family name, gender, and communication (phone number/email)

gender.Name: gender
gender.Optional:
One of the following input combinations must be provided at minimum:

  • _id (aka FHIR ID)
  • identifier in the form {IDType}|{ID}, which includes SSN
  • Given name, family name, and birthdate
  • Given name, family name, gender, and communication (phone number/email)

given.Name: given
given.Description: The patient's given name. May include first and middle names.
given.Optional:
One of the following input combinations must be provided at minimum:

  • _id (aka FHIR ID)
  • identifier in the form {IDType}|{ID}, which includes SSN
  • Given name, family name, and birthdate
  • Given name, family name, gender, and communication (phone number/email)

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: Identifiers and assigning authorities associated with a patient. These are of the format <OID>|<value>.
identifier.Optional:
One of the following input combinations must be provided at minimum:

  • _id (aka FHIR ID)
  • identifier in the form {IDType}|{ID}, which includes SSN
  • Given name, family name, and birthdate
  • Given name, family name, gender, and communication (phone number/email)

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description: Telephone numbers and email addresses for the patient, along with their use (i.e. home, work, etc.)
telecom.Optional:
One of the following input combinations must be provided at minimum:

  • _id (aka FHIR ID)
  • identifier in the form {IDType}|{ID}, which includes SSN
  • Given name, family name, and birthdate
  • Given name, family name, gender, and communication (phone number/email)

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: A single entry in the resource bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A single resource returned as part of this bundle.

active.Name: active
active.Description: Whether the patient record is active.

birthDate.Name: birthDate
birthDate.Description: The patient's date of birth in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

careProvider.Name: careProvider
careProvider.Description: PCP of type general for the patient. Reference to a Practitioner resource.

communication.Name: communication
communication.Description: A list of languages used to communicate with the patient, along with an indicator of which is preferred.

language.Name: language
language.Description: The patient's general language, onsite care language, and spoken language.

preferred.Name: preferred
preferred.Description: Whether the language is the patient's preferred language.

deceasedBoolean.Name: deceasedBoolean
deceasedBoolean.Optional: deceasedDateTime is returned whenever available. If not available, deceasedBoolean will be returned.

deceasedDateTime.Name: deceasedDateTime
deceasedDateTime.Description: The date and time at which the patient was deceased.
deceasedDateTime.Optional: deceasedDateTime is returned whenever available. If not available, deceasedBoolean will be returned.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: Identifiers and assigning authorities associated with a patient. These are of the format <OID>|<value>.

name.Name: name
name.Description:
The patient's name.

  • Starting in the May 2020 version of Epic, this element includes both the patient's "official" name, which is the patient's legal name, and the patient's "usual" name, which is the patient's preferred name.
    • If the patient does not have a preferred name defined in your system, the "usual" name also holds the patient's legal name.
    • In a patient-facing context, this web service always shows the patient's preferred name, unless a user has the security point 'Only Show Legal Name'.
  • In February 2020 and earlier, this element returns only the patient's legal name with a use code of "usual".

given.Name: given
given.Description: The patient's given name. May include first and middle names.

text.Name: text
text.Description: The patient's full name as a string.

use.Name: use
use.Description: The purpose of the name. May be "legal" or "usual". See the name parameter for full details on use.

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description: Telephone numbers and email addresses for the patient, along with their use (i.e. home, work, etc.)

system.Name: system
system.Description:
The type of telecom. Potential values are:

  • email
  • phone

use.Name: use
use.Description:
If the telecom entry is a phone number, possible values are:

  • home
  • mobile
  • work

value.Name: value
value.Description: Value of the telecom method. May be an email address or phone number.
